definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: We are sending a little gift for your new arrival.
sentences.chinese: 我们寄上一份薄礼，给你们新诞生的小宝宝。

sentences.english: This is to thank you for your generosity and hospitality.
sentences.chinese: 薄礼一份，感谢你的慷慨和热情款待。

sentences.english: Please accept this gift as a mark of our respect.
sentences.chinese: 请接受我们这份薄礼，以表敬意。

sentences.english: Robert was delighted to see me and equally pleased with my little gift.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特见到我很高兴，对我的薄礼也感到满意。

sentences.english: Please accept the gift in appreciation of all you've finiITd for us.
sentences.chinese: 请接受我的薄礼，让我表达你对我的鼎力支持。

definition: (of a gift) to be a small token of one's feelings
dilute wine/insipid wine/I'm sorry the wine I offer you is so poor (humble)
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to prepare/to arrange (sth to be offered)
lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to offer an apology/to make amends
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
